Detailed Description

Retrieve Spike infos.

The SpikeInfo class provides information about a spike data stream. Information is organized in three levels:

  1. general information
  2. channel specific information
  3. spike unit specific information

Example: 

void CTestDLLDoc::ReadSpikeInfo()
{
// DP 01/2003
// this method describes the principle of reading spike info
// from an MC_Rack data file. In a real import method the code
// has to be optimized!!

    IMCSInfoSpike InfoSpike;

    InfoSpike.AttachDispatch(m_MCSStream.GetInfo());
    
    short iDetectMethod = InfoSpike.GetDetectMethod();
    short iSortMethod = InfoSpike.GetSortMethod();
    float fPreTrigger = InfoSpike.GetPreTrigger();
    float fPostTrigger = InfoSpike.GetPostTrigger();
    float fDeadTime = InfoSpike.GetDeadTime();

    for(long i = 0; i < m_MCSStream.GetChannelCount(); ++i)
    {
        IMCSChannel Channel;
        Channel.AttachDispatch(m_MCSStream.GetChannel(i));
        short iChHWID = Channel.GetHwid();
        short iChBufferIndex = Channel.GetId();
        Channel.ReleaseDispatch();

        short iChannelGroupID = InfoSpike.GetChannelGroupID(iChHWID);
        float fThresholdLevel = InfoSpike.GetThresholdLevel(iChHWID);
        short iThresholdSlope = InfoSpike.GetThresholdSlope(iChHWID);
        float fSlopeDeltaV = InfoSpike.GetSlopeDeltaV(iChHWID);
        float fSlopeMin = InfoSpike.GetSlopeMin(iChHWID);
        float fSlopeMax = InfoSpike.GetSlopeMax(iChHWID);

        short iUnitCount = InfoSpike.GetSpikeUnitCount();
        for( short j = 0; j < iUnitCount; ++j)
        {
            short iUnitID = InfoSpike.GetSpikeUnitID(j);
            float fSpikeUnitWndTime = InfoSpike.GetSpikeUnitWndTime(iChHWID, iUnitID);
            float fSpikeUnitWndMin = InfoSpike.GetSpikeUnitWndMin(iChHWID, iUnitID);
            float fSpikeUnitWndMax = InfoSpike.GetSpikeUnitWndMax(iChHWID, iUnitID);
        }
    }
    InfoSpike.ReleaseDispatch();
}

Member Function Documentation

short CMCSAInfoSpike::GetChannelGroupID ( short  iChHWID  ) 

Get channel group ID.

Channels could be arranged in groups (stereotodes, tetrodes, ...). Each grouped channel has an ID > 0; if a channel is not a member of a group GetChannelGroupID returns zero.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
Returns:
group ID mif not zero
float CMCSAInfoSpike::GetDeadTime (  ) 

Get dead time.

The dead time defines the time interval after a detected spike, in which no spike detection is performed.

Deprecated:
this function should not be used any more, use GetDeadTime_us() instead
Returns:
dead time in seconds
int CMCSAInfoSpike::GetDeadTime_us (  ) 

Get dead time.

The dead time defines the time interval after a detected spike, in which no spike detection is performed.

Returns:
dead time in micro seconds
short CMCSAInfoSpike::GetDetectMethod (  ) 

Get spike detection method.

Currently two spike detection methods are possible: threshold detection, and slope detection. Threshold detection is represented by 0, slope detection is represented by 1.

Returns:
  • 0 = threshold detection
  • 1 = slope detection
char * CMCSAInfoSpike::GetInputBufferID (  ) 

Get input buffer ID.

Get buffer ID of the raw data buffer which is the input data stream of the spike sorter instrument.

Returns:
string of 8 characters, for example elec0001, filt0002.

float CMCSAInfoSpike::GetSlopeDeltaV ( short  iChHWID  ) 

Get voltage difference of slope detection method.

The slope detection methode is based on a range of signal slopes, given by the minimum and maximum slope, combined with a minimum voltage difference. If the voltage difference is negative the signal has to get more negative, if the voltage difference is positive the signal has to get more positive.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
Returns:
voltage difference in volts
float CMCSAInfoSpike::GetSlopeMax ( short  iChHWID  ) 

Get maximum slope of slope detection method.

The slope detection methode is based on a range of signal slopes, given by the minimum and maximum slope, combined with a minimum voltage difference.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
Returns:
maximum slope in volts/seconds (or µV/µs)
float CMCSAInfoSpike::GetSlopeMin ( short  iChHWID  ) 

Get minimum slope of slope detection method.

The slope detection methode is based on a range of signal slopes, given by the minimum and maximum slope, combined with a minimum voltage difference.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
Returns:
minimum slope in volts/seconds (or µV/µs)
short CMCSAInfoSpike::GetSortMethod (  ) 

Get spike sorting method.

Currently only a window based sorting method is possible. If the spike are not classified GetSortmethod returns 0, if the spikes are sorted based on a window GetSortmethod returns 1.

Returns:
  • 0 = spikes not classified
  • 1 = window based sorting
short CMCSAInfoSpike::GetSpikeUnitCount (  ) 

Get spike unit count.

Get the number of spike units defined for spike sorting.

Returns:
number of spike units

Get spike unit ID.

Get the number of spike units defined for spike sorting.

Returns:
number of spike units
float CMCSAInfoSpike::GetSpikeUnitWndMax ( short  iChHWID,
short  iUnitID 
)

Get maximum voltage of the sorting window.

The sorting time window is defined by a time point (relative to the first data point of the spike cut out), and a minimum and maximum voltage.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
iUnitID spike unit ID assocciated with the spike sorting window
Returns:
maximum voltage in volts

short  iUnitID 
)

Get minimum voltage of the sorting window.

The sorting time window is defined by a time point (relative to the first data point of the spike cut out), and a minimum and maximum voltage.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
iUnitID spike unit ID assocciated with the spike sorting window
Returns:
minimum voltage in volts

short  iUnitID

The sorting time window is defined by a time point (relative to the first data point of the spike cut out), and a minimum and maximum voltage.

Parameters:

iUnitID spike unit ID assocciated with the spike sorting window
Returns:
time point of the sort window in seconds
float CMCSAInfoSpike::GetThresholdLevel ( short  iChHWID  ) 

Get threshold level.

Get threshold level in volts used for the channel with iChHWID. The returned value is valid only if spike detection was based on the threshold method, i.e. if GetDetectMethod == 0.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
Returns:
threshold in volts
short CMCSAInfoSpike::GetThresholdSlope ( short  iChHWID  ) 

Get slope for threshold detection.

Get slope used for the channel with iChHWID. A spike is detected only if the signal crosses the threshold with the correct slope. Positive slope: signal gets more positive; negative slope: signal gets more negative. The returned value is valid only if spike detection was based on the threshold method, i.e. if GetDetectMethod == 0.

Parameters:
iChHWID channel hardware ID
Returns:
  • if slope == 0: positive slope
  • if slope == 1: negative slope
